title: Design Transformation Service Interface and Data Flow
description: Define the `ITransformationService` interface in C#. Design the data flow for passing `System.Text.Json.JsonNode` to and from the Jint engine, including serialization/deserialization strategy. Define the `TransformationResult` DTO for success/error states.
sprint_goal: Establish the foundational backend, including the secure Jint execution engine, basic script persistence with encryption, and API access control.
acceptance_criteria: Interface `ITransformationService` is defined with an `ExecuteAsync` method. DTOs for request and result (`TransformationRequest`, `TransformationResult`) are defined. A design document or diagram outlining the data marshalling process is created and reviewed.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Peer review of design.
business_value: Provides the fundamental, secure data manipulation capability, which is a core feature of the product.

title: Implement Jint Engine Wrapper Service
description: Create the `JintTransformationService` class implementing `ITransformationService`. This includes instantiating the Jint engine, marshalling the `JsonNode` input to a JavaScript object, executing the script, and parsing the result back to a `JsonNode`.
sprint_goal: Establish the foundational backend, including the secure Jint execution engine, basic script persistence with encryption, and API access control.
acceptance_criteria: The service can execute a simple script that modifies a JSON property. The service correctly handles JSON arrays and nested objects. The service is registered for dependency injection in the .NET application.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Unit testing for simple and complex transformations.
business_value: Provides the fundamental, secure data manipulation capability, which is a core feature of the product.

title: Implement Jint Sandbox Constraints
description: Enhance the `JintTransformationService` to configure the engine with security constraints loaded from `appsettings.json`. This includes execution timeout, memory allocation limit, statement count limit, and disabling CLR access.
sprint_goal: Establish the foundational backend, including the secure Jint execution engine, basic script persistence with encryption, and API access control.
acceptance_criteria: The service applies constraints using `engine.Options`.`AllowClr(false)`.`MaxStatements(...)`.`TimeoutInterval(...)`.`MemoryLimit(...)`. Configuration values for these constraints are successfully loaded from `IConfiguration`. The implementation is covered by specific integration tests for each constraint.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Integration tests for each sandbox constraint (timeout, memory, statement count, no CLR).
business_value: Ensures user-provided code cannot compromise the host application.

title: Implement Exception Handling and Error Structuring
description: Wrap Jint execution in robust try-catch blocks. Catch `Jint.Runtime.JavaScriptException` and sandbox violation exceptions (`MemoryLimitExceededException`, etc.). Map these exceptions to the structured `TransformationResult` error DTO and log them.
sprint_goal: Establish the foundational backend, including the secure Jint execution engine, basic script persistence with encryption, and API access control.
acceptance_criteria: A script throwing a `ReferenceError` is caught. Exception details (message, line number, stack trace) are correctly extracted and populated in the error DTO. A timeout violation is caught and mapped to a specific timeout error DTO. All caught exceptions are logged with structured context (e.g., script ID).
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Unit tests for each exception handling path.
business_value: Improves robustness and provides clear feedback for debugging scripts.

title: Develop Performance Benchmark Test Suite
description: Create an automated performance test (REQ-PERF-DTR-002) that executes the transformation service with a 10MB JSON input file and a benchmark script of at least 200 statements. The test must fail if execution exceeds 10 seconds on specified hardware.
sprint_goal: Establish the foundational backend, including the secure Jint execution engine, basic script persistence with encryption, and API access control.
acceptance_criteria: A performance test exists in the xUnit test suite, categorized as 'Performance'. The test uses a large JSON input file (~10MB) and a representative JS script file. The test accurately measures the execution time of the transformation service. The test fails the build if the 10-second threshold is breached.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Automated performance test integrated into CI pipeline.
business_value: Ensures the feature meets critical performance NFRs before release.

title: Implement Engine Crash Handling
description: Ensure the service that invokes the Jint engine (e.g., a background job processor) has a top-level try-catch block to handle catastrophic, unrecoverable errors from within Jint (like StackOverflowException), preventing the main application service from crashing.
sprint_goal: Establish the foundational backend, including the secure Jint execution engine, basic script persistence with encryption, and API access control.
acceptance_criteria: A script designed to cause a Stack Overflow is executed within a background job context. The specific job is marked as 'Failed'. The main .NET service process remains running and continues to process other jobs. A 'FATAL' level error is logged with details of the unhandled exception.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Integration test that simulates a catastrophic script failure.
business_value: Improves system reliability and prevents catastrophic failures.

title: Define Script & Version DB Entities and Migration
description: Define the `TransformationScript` and `TransformationScriptVersion` entities using EF Core. `TransformationScript` will hold metadata and a pointer to the active version. `TransformationScriptVersion` will hold the script content and version metadata. Create the initial DB migration.
sprint_goal: Establish the foundational backend, including the secure Jint execution engine, basic script persistence with encryption, and API access control.
acceptance_criteria: C# entity classes are created with appropriate properties and relationships. An EF Core migration is generated using `dotnet ef migrations add`. The migration can be successfully applied to a test database.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Successful application of the migration.
business_value: Enables the management of reusable business logic.

title: Implement Transparent Encryption for Script Content
description: Implement an EF Core `ValueConverter` using .NET Data Protection APIs (DPAPI) to encrypt the `Content` of the `TransformationScriptVersion` entity before saving and decrypt it upon retrieval. Configure DPAPI for a production environment (shared key store).
sprint_goal: Establish the foundational backend, including the secure Jint execution engine, basic script persistence with encryption, and API access control.
acceptance_criteria: The `ValueConverter` is implemented and applied to the `Content` property in the `DbContext`. DPAPI is configured with a persistent key store (e.g., file system or Azure Blob Storage). An integration test confirms that data saved to the DB is encrypted and can be successfully decrypted by the application.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Integration test and direct database inspection to confirm encryption.
deployment_notes: Requires careful DPAPI key management setup in production environments.
business_value: Ensures sensitive script content is protected through encryption at rest.

title: Implement Script Repository for CRUD Operations
description: Create the `ScriptRepository` implementing `IScriptRepository`. Implement the `Create`, `GetById`, `GetAll`, and `Delete` methods. The initial `Create` method will create both the script and its first version.
sprint_goal: Establish the foundational backend, including the secure Jint execution engine, basic script persistence with encryption, and API access control.
acceptance_criteria: Repository methods correctly interact with the `DbContext`. The `Create` method successfully creates both parent and child version records in a single transaction. The `Delete` method correctly removes the parent script and all its associated versions.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Unit tests using an in-memory database.
business_value: Provides the data access layer for script management.

title: Implement API Endpoints for Script CRUD
description: Create the `TransformationsController` with `POST`, `GET`, `GET/{id}`, and `DELETE` actions. Wire these actions to a `ScriptService` that uses the `ScriptRepository`. Secure all endpoints to be accessible only by Administrators.
sprint_goal: Establish the foundational backend, including the secure Jint execution engine, basic script persistence with encryption, and API access control.
acceptance_criteria: API endpoints for Create, Read (List and by ID), and Delete are functional. Requests from non-Administrator users are rejected with a 403 Forbidden status. API is documented with Swagger/OpenAPI, including request/response DTOs.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Integration tests for the API endpoints.
business_value: Exposes script management functionality to the UI and external systems.

title: Apply RBAC to Backend Script Management APIs
description: Add `[Authorize(Roles = "Administrator")]` attributes to the `TransformationsController` and `TransformationVersionsController` classes to restrict all actions within them to users in the 'Administrator' role.
sprint_goal: Establish the foundational backend, including the secure Jint execution engine, basic script persistence with encryption, and API access control.
acceptance_criteria: All endpoints in the specified controllers are decorated with the authorization attribute. An integration test confirms that a request with a 'Viewer' role token is rejected with 403 Forbidden. An integration test confirms that a request with an 'Administrator' role token is accepted.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Integration tests for authorization of all script management endpoints.
business_value: Enforces the principle of least privilege for a security-sensitive feature.

title: Implement Conditional Rendering for Script UI based on Role
description: In the React application, create or use a hook (e.g., `useUserRole`) to get the current user's role. Use this to conditionally render navigation links, buttons ('Create', 'Edit', 'Delete'), and routes related to script management.
sprint_goal: Establish the foundational backend, including the secure Jint execution engine, basic script persistence with encryption, and API access control.
acceptance_criteria: A user logged in with the 'Viewer' role does not see the 'Transformations' link in the main navigation. Attempting to navigate directly to `/transformations` as a 'Viewer' redirects them or shows a 'Forbidden' page. A user logged in as an 'Administrator' can see and access all script management UI.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: E2E test for the 'Viewer' user access denial.
business_value: Enforces the principle of least privilege in the user interface.

title: Integrate and Configure Monaco Editor Component
description: Research, install, and configure the `@monaco-editor/react` package. Create a `ScriptEditor` React component that wraps the editor and configures it for the JavaScript language, enabling syntax highlighting, code completion, and real-time validation.
sprint_goal: Deliver the core administrator experience by building the rich script editor UI and the essential preview functionality for rapid development and debugging.
epic: Control Panel UI for Script Management
acceptance_criteria: The Monaco editor renders within a React component. JavaScript syntax is correctly highlighted. Basic code completion (intellisense) is functional. Syntax errors are marked with squiggles.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Component is visible and functional in Storybook or a test page.
deployment_notes: May increase application bundle size; consider lazy loading.
business_value: Provides a modern, developer-friendly editing experience.

title: Implement Editor State Management
description: Wire the `ScriptEditor` component into the Create/Edit page. Manage its content in the page's state (e.g., Zustand store). Implement logic to use Monaco's validation markers to determine if the script is syntactically valid and conditionally disable the page's 'Save' button.
sprint_goal: Deliver the core administrator experience by building the rich script editor UI and the essential preview functionality for rapid development and debugging.
epic: Control Panel UI for Script Management
acceptance_criteria: Editor content updates are reflected in the parent component's state. The 'Save' button is disabled when the editor reports syntax errors. The 'Save' button is enabled when the editor reports no syntax errors.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Component tests for the save button logic.
business_value: Prevents saving of syntactically incorrect scripts.

title: Implement Three-Pane Resizable Layout Component
description: Using a library like `react-resizable-panels`, create a layout for the script editor page that includes three panes: one for the script editor, one for sample data input, and one for the output. The dividers between panes must be draggable.
sprint_goal: Deliver the core administrator experience by building the rich script editor UI and the essential preview functionality for rapid development and debugging.
epic: Control Panel UI for Script Management
acceptance_criteria: The page renders with three distinct panes. The user can drag the dividers to resize the panes. The layout remains stable and does not break during resizing.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Manual testing and E2E test for resizing functionality.
business_value: Provides a flexible and user-friendly layout for script development.

title: Implement Sample Data Preview UI Logic
description: Add a 'Preview' button to the UI. On click, it should take the content from the script editor and the sample data editor, call the `POST /api/v1/transformations/preview` endpoint, and display the result or error in the output pane. Implement loading and error states.
sprint_goal: Deliver the core administrator experience by building the rich script editor UI and the essential preview functionality for rapid development and debugging.
epic: Control Panel UI for Script Management
acceptance_criteria: UI correctly calls the preview API with script and sampleData. A loading spinner is shown during the API call. A successful JSON response is formatted and displayed in the output pane. An error response is displayed in a user-friendly format in the output pane.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Component tests for loading and error states.
business_value: Enables the rapid debugging and validation feedback loop.

title: Implement Live Data Preview UI Logic
description: Add a dropdown to the UI to select a data connector. The list of connectors should be fetched from the backend. Add a 'Preview with Live Data' button that calls the preview API, passing the `connectorId` instead of sample data.
sprint_goal: Deliver the core administrator experience by building the rich script editor UI and the essential preview functionality for rapid development and debugging.
epic: Control Panel UI for Script Management
acceptance_criteria: Connector dropdown is populated from a GET API call. The 'Preview with Live Data' button is disabled until a connector is selected. Clicking the button correctly calls the preview API with the `connectorId`. The result is displayed in the output pane, same as the sample data preview.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: E2E test with a sample live data connector.
business_value: Allows validation against real data structures.

title: Implement Server-Side Timeout Handling in UI
description: Enhance the preview UI logic to specifically handle the timeout error response from the backend API. When a timeout occurs, display a clear, specific error message in the output pane.
sprint_goal: Deliver the core administrator experience by building the rich script editor UI and the essential preview functionality for rapid development and debugging.
epic: Control Panel UI for Script Management
acceptance_criteria: When the preview API returns a timeout error (e.g., 408 or a specific error code), the UI detects it. A specific error message is displayed: 'Execution timed out after 30 seconds...'. The UI correctly exits the loading state.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: A component test for the timeout error state.
business_value: Improves UI stability and provides clear feedback on performance issues.

title: Display Persistent Performance Warning in Report Config UI
description: In the separate Report Configuration UI, implement the logic to display a persistent warning message (REQ-UI-DTR-001) whenever a transformation script is associated with a report.
sprint_goal: Deliver the core administrator experience by building the rich script editor UI and the essential preview functionality for rapid development and debugging.
epic: Control Panel UI for Script Management
acceptance_criteria: The Report Configuration page includes a transformation script selector. When a script is selected, a warning message appears. The warning message contains the required text and a link. When 'None' is selected, the warning disappears.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Component test for the warning's conditional rendering.
business_value: Proactively manages user expectations about performance.

title: CRUD UI for Transformation Scripts
description: Implement the main list view for transformation scripts. It should display all scripts and include actions for 'Create New', 'Edit', and 'Delete'. This serves as the entry point to the editor.
sprint_goal: Deliver the core administrator experience by building the rich script editor UI and the essential preview functionality for rapid development and debugging.
epic: Control Panel UI for Script Management
acceptance_criteria: A page exists that lists all transformation scripts from the API. A 'Create New' button navigates to the editor page. Each script in the list has 'Edit' and 'Delete' actions. The 'Delete' action includes a confirmation modal.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: E2E test for the CRUD lifecycle from the UI.
business_value: Provides the main user interface for managing the script library.

title: Implement Preview API Controller
description: Create `TransformationPreviewController.cs` with a `POST /api/v1/transformations/preview` endpoint. The controller will take a DTO with script, sampleData, and connectorId. It will orchestrate calls to the connector service (if needed) and the transformation service.
sprint_goal: Deliver the core administrator experience by building the rich script editor UI and the essential preview functionality for rapid development and debugging.
acceptance_criteria: The endpoint is created and documented in Swagger. It correctly handles requests with `sampleData` vs. `connectorId`. It returns 200 OK on success and 400 Bad Request for script syntax errors.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Integration tests covering both sample data and live data paths.
business_value: Provides the core API for the interactive preview UI.

title: Implement Server-Side Timeout for Preview API
description: In the `TransformationPreviewController`, create a `CancellationTokenSource` with a configurable timeout (default 30s). Pass the `CancellationToken` to all downstream services, including the Jint transformation service, to ensure the entire operation is cancellable.
sprint_goal: Deliver the core administrator experience by building the rich script editor UI and the essential preview functionality for rapid development and debugging.
acceptance_criteria: A long-running preview request is terminated after the configured timeout. The API returns an appropriate timeout error status (e.g., 408 or 504). The timeout event is logged.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Integration test to verify timeout behavior.
business_value: Protects the server from runaway preview scripts.

title: Add Authorization to Preview API
description: Secure the `TransformationPreviewController` using the `[Authorize(Roles = "Administrator")]` attribute to ensure only authenticated administrators can use the preview functionality.
sprint_goal: Deliver the core administrator experience by building the rich script editor UI and the essential preview functionality for rapid development and debugging.
acceptance_criteria: Requests from unauthenticated users are rejected with 401 Unauthorized. Requests from authenticated non-administrators are rejected with 403 Forbidden.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Integration tests for authorization.
business_value: Ensures only authorized users can execute arbitrary code.

title: Implement 'Update' Versioning Logic
description: Modify the `ScriptRepository`'s `UpdateAsync` method. The logic must create a new `TransformationScriptVersion` record with the updated content and then update the parent `TransformationScript`'s `ActiveVersionId` foreign key to point to the new version. This must be a single atomic transaction.
sprint_goal: Implement critical change management and compliance features, including script versioning logic and a comprehensive, immutable audit trail for all sensitive operations.
acceptance_criteria: Calling `UpdateAsync` on a script creates a new version record. The parent script's `ActiveVersionId` is correctly updated. The entire operation is wrapped in a `DbContext` transaction. An integration test proves that a partial failure rolls back all changes.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Integration test for transactional update.
business_value: Provides a critical safety net for configuration management.

title: Implement 'Revert to Version' Logic
description: In a `ScriptService`, implement the `RevertAsync` method. This method will fetch the content of the specified historical version, create a new `TransformationScriptVersion` with that content, and then set this new version as the active one on the parent `TransformationScript`.
sprint_goal: Implement critical change management and compliance features, including script versioning logic and a comprehensive, immutable audit trail for all sensitive operations.
acceptance_criteria: The `RevertAsync` method successfully creates a new version that is a copy of an old one. The new version is correctly set as the active version. The operation is transactional and is audited.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Unit and integration tests for the revert logic.
business_value: Enables rapid recovery from errors.

title: Implement API Endpoints for Version Management
description: Create a new `TransformationVersionsController` with endpoints: `GET /api/v1/transformations/{id}/versions` to list all versions, and `POST /api/v1/transformations/{id}/versions/{versionId}/revert` to trigger the revert action. Also, update the `PUT /api/v1/transformations/{id}` endpoint to use the new versioning logic.
sprint_goal: Implement critical change management and compliance features, including script versioning logic and a comprehensive, immutable audit trail for all sensitive operations.
acceptance_criteria: The GET endpoint returns a list of version metadata. The POST revert endpoint successfully triggers the revert logic and returns the new version's data. The PUT update endpoint correctly creates a new version. All endpoints are secured for Administrator access only.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Integration tests for all new/updated endpoints.
business_value: Exposes version management functionality to the UI.

title: Design and Implement Audit Logger Service
description: Design the `IAuditLogger` service interface and its implementation. Define the data structure for audit log entries (e.g., timestamp, user, action, target, details, outcome). Decide on the initial storage mechanism (e.g., dedicated Serilog sink to a specific file or database table).
sprint_goal: Implement critical change management and compliance features, including script versioning logic and a comprehensive, immutable audit trail for all sensitive operations.
acceptance_criteria: An `IAuditLogger` service is defined and registered for DI. The service can write structured log events to a defined target. The log entry schema is finalized and documented.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Unit tests and code review.
business_value: Provides essential traceability and accountability for security-sensitive operations.

title: Integrate Audit Logging for Sandbox Violations
description: In the `JintTransformationService`'s exception handling blocks, inject and call the `IAuditLogger` service to log sandbox constraint violations (timeout, memory, statement count, CLR access).
sprint_goal: Implement critical change management and compliance features, including script versioning logic and a comprehensive, immutable audit trail for all sensitive operations.
acceptance_criteria: A timeout violation triggers an audit log event with 'ViolationType: Timeout'. A memory violation triggers an audit log event with 'ViolationType: Memory'. The log includes the script ID and other relevant context.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Integration tests to verify logging on violation.
business_value: Provides security visibility into script execution behavior.

title: Integrate Audit Logging for Script Management
description: Use a domain event pattern (e.g., with MediatR) to decouple business logic from auditing. Publish events like `ScriptCreatedEvent` from the `ScriptService`. Create event handlers that subscribe to these events and call the `IAuditLogger`.
sprint_goal: Implement critical change management and compliance features, including script versioning logic and a comprehensive, immutable audit trail for all sensitive operations.
acceptance_criteria: Creating, updating, and deleting a script each publish a domain event. Event handlers for these events correctly call the audit logger with the right context (user, entity, changes). Associating a script with a report also generates an audit event.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Integration tests for the event publishing and handling flow.
business_value: Provides auditability for all script configuration changes.

title: Implement Audit Log Immutability and Retention
description: Architect and implement the final storage solution for the audit trail to meet SOC 2 / ISO 27001 objectives. This includes ensuring tamper-evidence and a configurable retention period of at least one year.
sprint_goal: Implement critical change management and compliance features, including script versioning logic and a comprehensive, immutable audit trail for all sensitive operations.
acceptance_criteria: The chosen storage mechanism prevents modification of logs through application APIs. A mechanism to detect tampering (e.g., checksums) is implemented. A configurable data retention policy is implemented and defaults to 365 days. The architecture is documented and reviewed for compliance.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Security design review and penetration testing.
deployment_notes: May require specific infrastructure setup for WORM storage.
business_value: Enables compliance with enterprise governance standards.

title: Generate and Refine OpenAPI Specification
description: Review and annotate all new API controllers and DTOs with detailed XML comments (e.g., `<summary>`, `<param>`, `<response>`). Configure Swashbuckle to generate a high-quality OpenAPI 3.0 specification file.
sprint_goal: Implement critical change management and compliance features, including script versioning logic and a comprehensive, immutable audit trail for all sensitive operations.
acceptance_criteria: All transformation-related endpoints are present in the generated `openapi.json`. Each endpoint has a summary, parameter descriptions, and documented responses for success and error codes. Request and response schemas are accurate.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Manual inspection of the generated Swagger UI.
business_value: Improves user self-sufficiency for API integration.

title: Write User Guide and Technical Reference
description: Write two Markdown documents. 1) A User Guide explaining how to use the script management UI. 2) A Technical Reference detailing all custom functions and objects available in the script sandbox.
sprint_goal: Implement critical change management and compliance features, including script versioning logic and a comprehensive, immutable audit trail for all sensitive operations.
acceptance_criteria: A User Guide covering script CRUD, versioning, and previewing exists. A Technical Reference document lists all helper functions and global objects available in the script environment. Both documents are peer-reviewed for clarity and technical accuracy.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
collaboration_required: Backend team for technical reference accuracy
testing_requirements: Peer review of documentation.
business_value: Reduces support costs and enables administrators to use the feature effectively.

title: Create Version History Modal Component
description: Develop a React modal component that, given a script ID, fetches and displays the version history from the `GET /api/v1/transformations/{id}/versions` endpoint. The list should show version number, timestamp, and author, and include checkboxes for selection.
sprint_goal: Enhance the feature set with the versioning UI (diff/revert), operational monitoring via Prometheus, and advanced data validation rules to improve system robustness.
epic: Control Panel UI for Script Management
acceptance_criteria: The modal opens and fetches version history for the given script. The list of versions is displayed correctly. Checkboxes are present for each version.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Component tests and manual verification.
business_value: Provides the UI for change management.

title: Integrate Visual Diff Viewer
description: Integrate a library like `react-diff-viewer` into the version history modal. When exactly two versions are selected and a 'Compare' button is clicked, fetch the content of both versions and display a side-by-side diff.
sprint_goal: Enhance the feature set with the versioning UI (diff/revert), operational monitoring via Prometheus, and advanced data validation rules to improve system robustness.
epic: Control Panel UI for Script Management
acceptance_criteria: The 'Compare' button is enabled only when two versions are selected. Clicking 'Compare' fetches content for both versions. A visual diff is correctly rendered, highlighting additions and deletions.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: E2E test for the diffing functionality.
business_value: Allows for easy auditing of changes.

title: Implement 'Revert to Version' UI
description: Add a 'Revert' button to each historical version in the list. On click, show a confirmation dialog. If confirmed, call the `POST .../revert` API endpoint. On success, show a success notification and refresh the version history list.
sprint_goal: Enhance the feature set with the versioning UI (diff/revert), operational monitoring via Prometheus, and advanced data validation rules to improve system robustness.
epic: Control Panel UI for Script Management
acceptance_criteria: A 'Revert' button is present for each non-active version. Clicking it shows a confirmation modal. Confirming calls the correct API endpoint. The UI updates to reflect the new active version upon success.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: E2E test for the revert functionality.
business_value: Enables rapid rollback from configuration errors.

title: Implement Prometheus /metrics Endpoint
description: Integrate the `prometheus-net` library. Define a Histogram for execution duration and Counters for total executions, timeouts, and errors. Instrument the `JintTransformationService` to update these metrics. Expose the `/metrics` endpoint via ASP.NET Core middleware.
sprint_goal: Enhance the feature set with the versioning UI (diff/revert), operational monitoring via Prometheus, and advanced data validation rules to improve system robustness.
acceptance_criteria: The `/metrics` endpoint is accessible and returns Prometheus-formatted text. Executing a script updates the `script_execution_duration_seconds` histogram. A script timeout increments the `script_timeouts_total` counter. A script error increments the `script_errors_total` counter.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Integration test for metrics endpoint.
deployment_notes: Requires a Prometheus server to scrape the endpoint.
business_value: Provides critical observability into a core system component.

title: Buffer Data as JsonNode and Check Size
description: In the report processing service, refactor the data loading step to buffer the entire dataset into memory as a `System.Text.Json.JsonNode` object. Before passing it to the transformation engine, check the estimated in-memory size of the data.
sprint_goal: Enhance the feature set with the versioning UI (diff/revert), operational monitoring via Prometheus, and advanced data validation rules to improve system robustness.
acceptance_criteria: Data is correctly parsed into a `JsonNode` object. The use of `JsonNode` is verified via code review for performance. The `JsonNode` is successfully passed to the Jint service.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Code review and unit tests.
business_value: Improves system reliability by implementing critical safeguards.

title: Implement Configurable Maximum Dataset Size Limit
description: Add a configuration setting for the maximum dataset size (default 256MB). In the report processing service, before loading data into memory, check the source stream length (if available) or incrementally check size during reading against this limit. If exceeded, fail the job.
sprint_goal: Enhance the feature set with the versioning UI (diff/revert), operational monitoring via Prometheus, and advanced data validation rules to improve system robustness.
acceptance_criteria: A configuration value for `MaxDatasetSizeMb` is readable from `appsettings.json`. A job processing a dataset larger than this limit fails with a specific error message. The check is performant and avoids loading the entire large file into memory just to check its size.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Unit test for the size limit logic.
business_value: Improves system reliability against resource exhaustion.

title: Extend Report Configuration for JSON Schema
description: Update the `ReportConfiguration` entity to include a nullable string field for `JsonSchema`. Create a DB migration. Update the API DTOs and the frontend UI to include a text area for pasting the schema.
sprint_goal: Enhance the feature set with the versioning UI (diff/revert), operational monitoring via Prometheus, and advanced data validation rules to improve system robustness.
acceptance_criteria: The database schema is updated to store a JSON schema string. The Report Configuration UI includes a text area for the schema. The schema can be successfully saved and retrieved via the API.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: E2E test of saving a schema with a report.
business_value: Enforces data contracts and improves data quality.

title: Implement JSON Schema Validation Service
description: Create a `JsonSchemaValidationService` that uses the `JsonSchema.Net` library. The service will take a `JsonNode` (the script output) and a schema string, and return a validation result.
sprint_goal: Enhance the feature set with the versioning UI (diff/revert), operational monitoring via Prometheus, and advanced data validation rules to improve system robustness.
acceptance_criteria: The service correctly validates a valid `JsonNode` against a schema. The service returns detailed error messages for an invalid `JsonNode`. The service is covered by unit tests.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Passing unit tests for valid and invalid data.
business_value: Provides the core logic for data contract enforcement.

title: Integrate Schema Validation into Report Pipeline
description: In the main report processing service, after the transformation step, check if a JSON schema is associated with the report. If so, invoke the `JsonSchemaValidationService`. If validation fails, throw an exception to fail the job and ensure the error details are logged.
sprint_goal: Enhance the feature set with the versioning UI (diff/revert), operational monitoring via Prometheus, and advanced data validation rules to improve system robustness.
acceptance_criteria: The validation step is correctly integrated into the pipeline. A report job with invalid output fails at this step. The job log contains the specific schema validation errors.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Passing integration tests for the end-to-end validation flow.
business_value: Activates the data contract enforcement feature.

title: Implement Feature Flag for Transformation Feature
description: Implement a system-wide feature flag read from `appsettings.json`. In the backend, use middleware to block related API endpoints. In the frontend, use a global state/context to conditionally render all UI elements related to transformations.
sprint_goal: Prepare the feature for production rollout by creating migration tools, comprehensive documentation, and adding quality-of-life improvements like internationalization.
acceptance_criteria: When flag is 'false', transformation APIs return 404. When flag is 'false', transformation UI elements are not rendered. When flag is 'true', the feature is fully functional.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: E2E tests for both enabled and disabled states.
business_value: Reduces deployment risk and provides a rollback mechanism.

title: Develop Legacy Data Migration Script
description: Create a .NET console application that connects to the legacy data source, extracts transformation logic and report associations, then connects to the new application's database and uses its services/repositories to create the corresponding new entities.
sprint_goal: Prepare the feature for production rollout by creating migration tools, comprehensive documentation, and adding quality-of-life improvements like internationalization.
acceptance_criteria: The script successfully migrates a sample of legacy data. Report-to-script associations are preserved. A detailed Markdown document explains how to configure and run the script step-by-step. The script is idempotent (can be re-run without creating duplicates).
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Manual execution and validation of migrated data.
deployment_notes: One-time script to be run by professional services or customers.
business_value: Provides a clear path for migrating from legacy systems.

title: Document Operational Procedures
description: Create documentation for Backup/Recovery, Cutover, and Rollback procedures. The backup/recovery doc must be updated to include script tables. The cutover/rollback plan must detail steps for deployment, including feature flag and DB migration management.
sprint_goal: Prepare the feature for production rollout by creating migration tools, comprehensive documentation, and adding quality-of-life improvements like internationalization.
acceptance_criteria: Backup and Recovery document is updated to include script-related tables. A Cutover Plan document exists, defining go/no-go criteria. A Rollback Plan document exists, detailing steps to disable the feature flag and revert DB migrations.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Peer review of documentation.
business_value: Ensures the feature can be safely deployed and managed.

title: Document and Plan Legacy Decommissioning
description: Create a formal plan to identify and remove all legacy transformation code and database objects within 60 days of the full production release of the new feature.
sprint_goal: Prepare the feature for production rollout by creating migration tools, comprehensive documentation, and adding quality-of-life improvements like internationalization.
acceptance_criteria: A formal decommissioning plan document exists. The plan identifies all legacy code modules, libraries, and database tables to be removed. The plan includes a timeline and sign-off process.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Review and sign-off by the project architect.
business_value: Ensures technical debt is managed post-release.

title: Internationalize Backend Error Messages
description: Create .resx resource files for all user-facing error strings in the backend. Refactor services and controllers to use `IStringLocalizer`. Implement logic in an exception middleware to select the language based on the `Accept-Language` header.
sprint_goal: Prepare the feature for production rollout by creating migration tools, comprehensive documentation, and adding quality-of-life improvements like internationalization.
acceptance_criteria: Hardcoded error strings are removed and replaced with resource keys. Resource files for English (default) and at least one other language (e.g., Spanish) are created. An integration test verifies that different `Accept-Language` headers result in translated error messages.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Integration test for localization.
business_value: Enhances the product's usability for a global audience.

title: Internationalize Frontend Error Messages
description: Integrate a library like `react-i18next`. Externalize all user-facing strings in the script management UI (especially error notifications) into JSON translation files. Implement logic to display the correct language.
sprint_goal: Prepare the feature for production rollout by creating migration tools, comprehensive documentation, and adding quality-of-life improvements like internationalization.
acceptance_criteria: Error message strings are moved from components to JSON files. The UI displays translated error messages based on user's language setting.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: E2E tests to verify language switching.
business_value: Enhances the product's usability for a global audience.

title: Develop Administrator Training Module
description: Create training materials (slides, videos, or written guide) and a certification exam for system administrators covering the Data Transformation feature, as per REQ-OPER-IMP-003.
sprint_goal: Prepare the feature for production rollout by creating migration tools, comprehensive documentation, and adding quality-of-life improvements like internationalization.
acceptance_criteria: Training materials covering secure scripting, performance, and UI usage are created. A certification exam is created. The materials are ready for delivery via the corporate learning system.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Review by product management.
business_value: Improves user adoption and reduces support requests.
